Class PolygonShape

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Shape
        |
        +--EdgedShape
              |
              +--FilledShape
                    |
                    +--PolygonShape
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, DrawableElement
public class PolygonShape
extends FilledShape
implements java.lang.Cloneable

The PolygonShape class represents a Polygon in 2D space specified in integer coordinates. It encapsulates a description of a closed, 2D region within a coordinate space. It also contains an edge and fill color specified with a Color object.

See Also:
Polygon, Color

writeToStream

public void writeToStream(java.io.PrintWriter stream)
Writes the object's state to a PrintWriter stream. The state is written in the following manner (without any of the comments or the "----"): ---- PolygonShape // the class name // the number of vertices [] // the array of x coordinates* [] // the array of y coordinates* // the red component of the edge color // the green component of the edge color** // the blue component of the edge color** // the red component of the fill color // the green component of the fill color** // the blue component of the fill color** ---- the arrays are written out as one element per line if the edge or fill color is null, the red component is replaced with "-1" and the green and blue components are not written out.
Overrides:
writeToStream in class Shape
Parameters:
stream - the PrintWriter stream to write the state to
